name: Geek Fighter
author: KesieV
description:
That small park, in Lambrugo.

It is still there and is the same as ever. A swing, three spring animals, few sparse benches and trees. I was around 13 and I used to stay there with friends, mostly browsing magazines and talking about videogames. Marcello was living just one staircase far and he was my personal 'better gaming system' friend - a kind of relationship that any gamer should understand.

I used to play Commodore 64 at home, since my father was a huge fan, but despite its good Ghost 'n Goblins conversion, it really never matched Marcello's Game Boy and its Bomber Boy (1990) cartridge. That's because a Game Boy was an 'arcade in the pocket' - which mixes, in a device I liked to have, a place I liked to go - there were no arcades around, except for a bar mom said I shouldn't go to.

Then he decided to invite me in his home to show me Street Fighter II on his brand new Super Nintendo, and something broke: that porting was so good that I had the same excitement I had at arcade, in full sound and colors, but in his kitchen. So something that was just envy turned into enlightmnent: can videogames break the fourth wall so much that can make you feel to be elsewhere?

A bit later I discovered why that game was so crucial and well done: Sega and Nintendo battled the very crucial parts of console war on that game and its formula is so good that survived tens of years. But that's another story. For now...

Plot!

Is cooking better than retrogaming? Is acting as good as a brand new gadget? Time to settle that! Choose a geek, inspired by some I know, and smack your opponents away! Use LEFT/RIGHT for moving, DOWN for crouching and UP for jumping. Use the A BUTTON for attacking or performing one of your character special moves. Moves are listed in selection screen, where FW is forward, BW is backward, UP and DN are up and down and ATK is the A BUTTON. Good luck!

PS: Whoa! I surely was on fire when I decided to add a fighting game to the Wright! collection 3 years ago: 6 characters with individual movesets and backgrounds and full tournament mode with multiple endings! Sadly I had to respect the 2 weeks time limit and most of the graphics was made in a hurry. I decided to add the crucial VS mode, together with audio and hiscores. One day I'll fix the graphics too... or someone will help me on that!

fighters.name: KesieV
fighters.ending: The world started pixelating, losing colors. His retro-power was eating everything. Is this the end?
winPhrases: You're just a pirated version of me. Go away.
Polygons are still made of pixels. That's why I'll crush you forever.
New gadgets are good only just for retrogaming. I hope you've understand that now.
We both love classics, old man. But mine are way more fun.
Have a look to pixelated SNK girls. You'll find them way more sexy than your dirty artworks.
We don't need your orchestra anymore. We've chiptunes for good music now.
You act in tedious cutscenes and someone had to find a way to skip them. I'm that someone.
Chips and cola are good enough for playing videogames all night. You're unuseful.

fighters.name: White
fighters.ending: "Hey Kes, don't you think your retro-fighting game up is too easy?" "Wh---what you said?!"
winPhrases: Improved versions of your games exists. You've to accept that.
That's the best ending for player 2, my dear clone.
Don't think about gadgets. Think about better gaming systems.
Storytelling reached a new generation. Sorry, dad.
Hentai and ecchi games are insults to real modern gaming. You got what you deserve.
Go making some good soundtrack: that's the real use of music.
Videogames allow everyone to be anyone, not only for actors. Do you understand why you lost?
Food is good but gaming is way better. Sorry, pal.

fighters.name: Maururu
fighters.ending: With the tournament prize, Maururu founded a gadget company, in order to play with them before anyone.
winPhrases: A cheap gadget can play your old games anytime. And cheap gadgets are worthless.
Videogames are a limit. Gamification is an opportunity.
You don't have to be me. You've to get the same gadgets I have.
A batteryless stylus that can write on paper? Interesting gadget. It's mine now.
You know that there are gadgets for that. No need to look at that dirty images.
Sticks. Strings. Your stuff is too analogic for me. I had to destroy you and your stuff.
Your acting is totally gadget unrelated. You had to disappear.
Do you think that you can cook better than gadgets? I hope you changed your mind, now.

fighters.name: Sergey
fighters.ending: "I had an interesting experience. I'll write a book about that and I hope new generations will understand."
winPhrases: Your games doesn't have storytelling? So what's their use?
Interactivity just compensated flawed plots. Your workarounds are now over.
Why bringing thousands of books with you when you just need a single good one?
You can cite me. But you can't be me.
Hentai stories are all the same. I can teach you how to make a good story.
Music is literature and sound. Without my art, you're just a technique.
You're pretty good on acting. But now try with some classics.
Your food is for the body. But a lot of minds are starving. I've the right food so you've to wait.

fighters.name: Ninjoe
fighters.ending: "Oh no! I won the wrong contest! Where are you my little Kasumi? I'll reach you in Dead Or Alive!"
winPhrases: Pixelation is only for censuring. And censuring is bad.
Your games don't give any feeling to the player. Mine are way better.
Gadgets are heartless. You had to be punished.
Complex plot are just a waste of time. I need real contents.
You can't move now. Very well. Now talk: where is your ecchi collection?
Is there any music other than soft jazz? I don't think so.
I've found your theatre thing interesting. But you're all acting too much dressed.
Tentacles is all you need to eat.

fighters.name: Arnie
fighters.ending: "Is that music for YOU? Disappear from my sight!" After the tournament music had a king.
winPhrases: Making sounds using a single computer chip? You're kidding me, right?
Soundtracks is the only music you know? What a waste.
You said that music is good only for ringtones. You paid for your ignorance.
Can you hear a feeling in a book? No. That's why music is way better.
Your stupid music loops are just over now. And, please, dress up that ladies.
You tried to play my music with the wrong instruments. That's why you failed.
Without music you're just a guy jumping on a stage. You've to thank me if you're still alive.
Music and food are nearly the same. Except that food can make you fat.

fighters.name: Matt
fighters.ending: The tournament was all a play, in which theatre wins over all arts. The audience applauded for very long.
winPhrases: Wh... what was that thing on the screen? Abstractism?
So you pretend to play the role of someone else with a gamepad? For real?
Your meaningless addiction is so inspiring that I'll make a play about that.
Do your thing, old man: write for me. Nothing more.
Is acting the same scene forever a real art? No. Neither for modernism.
Theatre needs music as a painting needs its frame. You're functional.
You're a good mime. Nothing more.
Cooking is an art which repeats the same message over and over again. So, it's art for real?

fighters.name: Marsicano
fighters.ending: "It's incredible! They are serving food on local trains too!" "And it's only the beginning, my dear friend."
winPhrases: Veni. Vidi. Vici. My dear train friend.
Cooking Mama is all you know about cooking? Please.
Cooking with your own hands is cooking for real. Throw your gadgets away.
The only thing worthy to be read are recipes. And only good ones.
Your games are tasteless despite they are too much spicy. Disgusting.
We both use instruments for art. But mine can keep you alive.
You jumped for hours, should be hungry. Come to my kitchen, I'll prepare you something.
Same appearance. Wrong quantities. Wrong ingredients. Wrong timings. Disappear.

object.html:
